item.title: Andrew add a quote by John Greenleaf Whittier
item.description: "Of all sad words of tongue or pen, the saddest are these, 'It might have been." -- John Greenleaf Whittier

item.title: Andrew add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "Red hair, sir, in my opinion, is dangerous." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Andrew add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I could see that, if not actually disgruntled, he was far from being gruntled." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Evelyn Waugh
item.description: "Punctuality is the virtue of the bored." -- Evelyn Waugh

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "So, friends, every day do something that won't compute...Give your approval to all you cannot understand...Ask the questions that have no answers. Put your faith in two inches of humus that will build under the trees every thousand years...Laugh. Be joyful though you have considered all the facts....Practice resurrection." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "If God had wanted us to be concerned for the plight of the toads, he would have made them cute and furry. " -- Dave Barry

item.title: Andrew add a quote by David McCullough
item.description: "Any nation that expects to be ignorant and free," Jefferson said, "expects what never was and never will be." And if the gap between the educated and the uneducated in America continues to grow as it is in our time, as fast as or faster than the gap between the rich and the poor, the gap between the educated and the uneducated is going to be of greater consequence and the more serious threat to our way of life. We must not, by any means, misunderstand that." -- David McCullough
